page.title: 06FINDING WORK COVENTRY S.W.
page.content: Coventry{Job Centre}was founded in the early 1970s purely to help unemployed people to find work.Now it does a lot more than just that.Many of its users are school leavers without jobs who enrol there for{Youth Training {Schemes}on which Â£26.50 a week and work experience can be gained for 1 year.Training in interview techniques is also given.This Job Centre is one of the largest nationwide catering for the whole of Coventry and thus being centrally situated. The nearby{Department of Employment} provides the unemployed with money calculated according to any recent wage earned called Unemployment Benefit.Those who cannot afford to pay for such necessities as electricity can also claim Supplementary Benefit.Both payments are made in the form of Post Office Giro Bank cheques.
